section.title: Using RHEL as a Ceph Client
section.para: &kw-hos-phrase; supports the use of a RHEL compute node (specifically RHEL 7.2) as a Ceph client node. However, the rpm packages (to be installed on the RHEL compute nodes) to enable it to act as a Ceph client are not shipped with &kw-hos-phrase;. So, you will need to provide the necessary rpm packages on the &kw-hos; lifecycle manager node. This document describes the steps to achieve this.
section.bridgehead: Setting up a yum repo on Lifecycle Manager Node for Hosting the Ceph Client Packages for RHEL 7.2
section.para: On the lifecycle manager, execute the following steps:

listitem.para: Create the directory where the RHEL packages will be downloaded:
Download the following packages into the ~/third-party/ceph/pkgs/rhel/ directory:
listitem.screen: ceph-common-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm libbabeltrace-1.2.4-3.el7.x86_64.rpm libcephfs1-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm librados2-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm librbd1-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm lttng-ust-2.4.1-1.el7.x86_64.rpm python-cephfs-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm python-rados-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm python-rbd-0.94.7-0.el7.x86_64.rpm userspace-rcu-0.7.16-1.el7.x86_64.rpm

listitem.para: Execute the following commands to deploy and populate the yum repo on the lifecycle manager with above packages:
listitem.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost third-party-deploy.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost third-party-import.yml
